22#include <sys/cdefs.h>
23#ifndef lint
24__RCSID("$NetBSD: machdep.c,v 1.7 2017/01/24 23:29:13 christos Exp $");
25#endif
26
27#ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
28#include "config.h"
29#endif
30
31/*
32 * XXX - all we need, on platforms other than DEC OSF/1 (a/k/a Digital UNIX,
33 * a/k/a Tru64 UNIX), is "size_t", which is a standard C type; what do we
34 * need to do to get it defined? This is clearly wrong, as we shouldn't
35 * have to include UNIX or Windows system header files to get it.
36 */
37#include <netdissect-stdinc.h>
38
39#ifndef HAVE___ATTRIBUTE__
40#define __attribute__(x)
41#endif /* HAVE___ATTRIBUTE__ */
42
43#ifdef __osf__
44#include <sys/sysinfo.h>
45#include <sys/proc.h>
46
47#if !defined(HAVE_SNPRINTF)
48int snprintf(char *, size_t, const char *, ...)
49#ifdef __ATTRIBUTE___FORMAT_OK
50 __attribute__((format(printf, 3, 4)))
51#endif /* __ATTRIBUTE___FORMAT_OK */
52 ;
53#endif /* !defined(HAVE_SNPRINTF) */
54#endif /* __osf__ */
55
56#include "machdep.h"
57
58/*
59 * On platforms where the CPU doesn't support unaligned loads, force
60 * unaligned accesses to abort with SIGBUS, rather than being fixed
61 * up (slowly) by the OS kernel; on those platforms, misaligned accesses
62 * are bugs, and we want tcpdump to crash so that the bugs are reported.
63 *
64 * The only OS on which this is necessary is DEC OSF/1^W^WDigital
65 * UNIX^W^WTru64 UNIX.
66 */
67int
68abort_on_misalignment(char *ebuf _U_, size_t ebufsiz _U_)
69{
70#ifdef __osf__
71 static int buf[2] = { SSIN_UACPROC, UAC_SIGBUS };
72
73 if (setsysinfo(SSI_NVPAIRS, (caddr_t)buf, 1, 0, 0) < 0) {
74 (void)snprintf(ebuf, ebufsiz, "setsysinfo: errno %d", errno);
75 return (-1);
76 }
77#endif
78 return (0);
79}
80
